question.title: Why is Android Studio not recognizing PDFView from android-pdf-viewer, and how can I fix this?
question.body:
Red line when using <com.github.barteksc.pdfviewer.PDFView> in Android XML layout with android-pdf-viewer

I'm trying to create a simple Android app to display PDF files, and I'm using the android-pdf-viewer library by barteksc. I've added the following dependency in my build.gradle:

implementation 'com.github.barteksc:android-pdf-viewer:2.8.2'

Then, in my layout XML file, I try to include the PDFView like this:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<RelativeLayout
    xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    tools:context=".MainActivity">

    <com.github.barteksc.pdfviewer.PDFView
        android:id="@+id/idPDFView"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="match_parent" />

</RelativeLayout>

However, Android Studio shows a red underline for <com.github.barteksc.pdfviewer.PDFView>, and it doesn't recognize the class.

I also tried using a different version

implementation 'com.github.barteksc:android-pdf-viewer:3.2.0-beta.1'

But the issue remains â€” the PDFView class is still not recognized in XML or Java/Kotlin code.

What I've tried:

Cleaning and rebuilding the project

Syncing Gradle multiple times

Invalidating caches and restarting Android Studio

Checking the package name and spelling

Expected behavior: I expect Android Studio to recognize PDFView so I can use it in my layout and reference it in code.

answers.body:
I recently used that PDFView in a project, but with this dependency from jitpack (seems the project has moved):

in allprojects --> repositories

maven { url 'https://jitpack.io' } // for pdf viewer

in project build.gradle

implementation 'com.github.DImuthuUpe:AndroidPdfViewer:3.1.0-beta.1'

The package name is still the same in xml:

<com.github.barteksc.pdfviewer.PDFView
    android:id="@+id/pdfView"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"/>

question_comments.body: I would try out the new androidx.pdf Jetpack library, it's in alpha currently but it's an official Jetpack library (note that it currently only works on Android S+ with extension version 13 or above)

That dependency was for JCenter, apparently, which has been shut down, and it looks like the developer never got it moved to Maven Central. You've got two options, AFAICT: you could clone the library and handle it manually, or you could try to use JitPack instead of JCenter. There's a problem with the JitPack option, though, because the only available release of V2 has a build error. The older V1 has working releases, though, if you can use that instead.
